description: Borrowed from Latin adducere, adductum (“to lead or bring to”), from ad- + ducere (“to lead”). See duke, and compare adduct.

verbs.description: adduce (third-person singular simple present adduces, present participle adducing, simple past and past participle adduced)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To bring forward or offer, as an argument, passage, or consideration which bears on a statement or case; to cite; to allege.
examples: Enough could not be adduced to satisfy the purpose of illustration.
